statement.p: Elongation measures the amount a metal sample stretches under carefully applied force. It is used to measure how ductile (stretchable) that type of metal is. \displaystyle{R}=\frac{{{A}-{B}}}{{A}}\times{100}. A is the original area, and B is the area after the pull. The times 100 is to make it a percent.
